What Issues: I'm being charged shipping for a students previous flyer order.

I selected checks and sent the check in for the single students order but now I'm being charged shipping. It isn't fair to expect the classroom teacher to decide between paying shipping or getting books in a students hands.

What could we improve: I miss earning rewards that can be spent THAT month. I feel a lot less valued for putting in orders than I did before.

What Issues: My order has incorrect items and/or missing items;
What could we improve: The delivery service said the books would be delivered by 7 pm on Friday.  I waited for them - but they didn’t arrive til Saturday later on. Our family was gone for the weekend and I was worried they would be gone -just “sitting” on our porch. Our ring doorbell shows the postal worker just placed them at the edge and never bothered to knock or ring the bell. We could have told him a better place to leave them.   Then somehow the order was mixed up and Scholastic customer service lady told me couldn’t do anything and I could pay to send the books back if I wanted the bonus points reinstated.  😕

What was great: Fast delivery of my order.
The email notifications were great and helpful. The service was as expected, nothing was damaged, the order was complete. :)

What Issues: My account would not calculate or allow any bonus points for my order.
What could we improve: I had a terrible time with placing my order and then collecting bonus points. I had parents send in online orders, but because my due date was the beginning of the month, one order got automatically filled while the other two sat in my cart. I didn't get an email for the last order that was placed online, so I didn't even know about it until I went in to look at items I wanted to order. It was very fragmented and disorganized, not at all like experiences I have had previous to this.   I do not love the auto order feature. It messed up my bonus points and I missed out on going to another level of points (getting almost 1000 more) because of this feature. I understand it is probably there to help teachers who lose track of things, but when it comes to points and putting orders together to get bonuses, it stinks.   Finally, I was unable to collect my bonus points--they would not calculate for my $231 order and the coupon I had to earn more points (300 for a May order) kept saying it was invalid. I called customer service and a very helpful gentleman named Ed helped me get the coupon points (300) but I had to chat with another rep the next day when my 1000 points did not show up in my account. She saw quickly that I did not get them, but no one--not even a supervisor--could figure out why my account was not tallying the extra points or allowing coupons. I am leery about putting in another order because I simply don't have time to call customer service and spend 20-30 minutes getting my account straightened out every time.   I have been doing scholastic book orders for all of my 22 years of teaching and this was my worst experience by far. I love the online platform, parents love it, and I continually encourage my parents to buy their children books. I am a loyal customer and love this service, but there are so many duties for me now as a teacher that I do not have time to spend fixing things that have never been a problem before.

What could we improve: My district has to approve the order and set up a P.O.  Many times I lose out on bonus points or I have to call because the order will not include bonus point items because they aren't paid items.  I can add in the P.O. number as soon as it gets ordered, but them it doubles the order.   This has caused us to pay twice because he order gets doubled.  On all those occasions, I have been accused of not paying the bill and it has even shut down my account saying that I have a balance.  My financial clerk pays with the first P.O. then has to wait for the 2nd P.O. to come through and then is sent.  I have argued with some of your staff about the fact that we have indeed paid twice but somehow in all the confusion, you have the money, but it does not go to my account.  Also, I spend lots of money every year for my school.  The 400 bonus points for the golden apple needs to be in my account and stay instead of expiring.  I spend too much money for it to be limited.
Additional Comments: See previous comments.

What could we improve: I am not liking the new way that you are auto submitting online orders. If you are going to offer free shipping with a parent online order then I should have the control to submit my order when I am ready to do so for the month. Instead your company is just taking more money away from me personally.
Additional Comments: Please just fix the auto order. I really dislike it and it’s making me very unhappy with ordering. I put my due dates on the website and feel nothing should be submitted until that due date.

My secretary and I finally decided to open it and the packing slip had my name on it but the box only had my school's address.

What was great: The timeliness of the order arriving.

What could we improve: I am really upset at how you are finding ways to cut costs instead of upgrading teacher rewards. Sending a paper coupon in my box to use for next month is adding more work and making it less likely that I will remember to use, therefore saving you money. I already forgot to use my February coupon, because I left it in my classroom and was placing my order from home over the weekend. Not to mention, dollar books are not announced on time to place my monthly order. I can't be placing multiple orders per month just to get the dollar books. That was a terrible idea. I talked to other teachers and they said that after the shipping debacle of a couple of years ago, they are no longer interested in participating and these new ideas of yours are most definitely not he way to win them back.
Additional Comments: My additional comments were already mentioned. Its now your Teacher Rewards system that you need to upgrade because we definitely feel you have downgraded us.

What could we improve: Sometimes I receive a box that had damaged books. The pages are crumpled or bent or the cover is damaged. A little more care in packing the boxes would be helpful.
Not be sold out of books, if it was available when my student ordered, it shouldn’t all of a sudden be out of stock if I didn’t place the order right away.

What Issues: I have not received a package;,Delivered on a day we are not is session.
What could we improve: It is difficult to navigate from when orders are placed to ordering for teacher or using bonus points.  Also, one order self submitted making my final order smaller.
Additional Comments: Less students are ordering not because of low interest but because books are getting more expensive.  Need to keep the 2-3$ range for kids who want to order but parents cannot afford.

What was great: Quick delivery
Additional Comments: My only complaint is that I received 2 boxes. One had a book, and another had the activity booklets. It was way too much packaging! Perhaps Scholastic could start using envelopes for smaller orders so there is not so much waste.

What was great: Timeliness

What could we improve: One of my books was crammed at the top of the box and was all bent out of shape.

What was great: Fast service
Prices are low and we get our orders within 10 business days.
Timely delivery for free standard shipping
Additional Comments: The only thing I have been very disappointed in this year is that I don't get the $10 coupon to spend on free books at the time of the order each month. I have to wait until the next month and ONLY if I am able to turn in an order of a certain amount for that next month. I work for a Title 1 school district and am not always able to collect student orders for each month. I wish you would go back to allowing people to be able to spend the $10 coupon in the same month that they earn the coupon. The coupon has always allowed me to order books that put free books in my students' hands whose families don't have the financial means to order books on their own, as well as adding to my classroom library when needed. Sadly, I have had to just throw away the $10 coupons earned because I didn't have an order to turn in. I would say that I have had to throw away between 2-3 coupons that I could have used if they were able to be used with the same order in which they were earned.

What was great: Quick and accurate service.
Fast
Notified of online sales and shipped quickly
Additional Comments: I feel that ordering for teachers could be easier with a slightly different format. Adding coupons and discount codes and understanding points is ok after you have used the system for a while but can seem frustrating to someone new.

What Issues: I was not happy that you changed your policy that teachers now have to wait a month to get their $10 in free credit on a current order. This is not right in so many ways.
What could we improve: It's not right that you changed your policy and now teachers have to wait until the following month to use their $10 they have earned on their current book order. It's like you want us to miss out on the free books. There are times when kids don't order every month or it's the end of the year and we don't place a book order so we lose out. The reason we push book orders is due to the bonus things we get by taking it away there is less reason to push them. I know I and a lot of my co-workers are upset about this.
Additional Comments: Please change your $10 earned credit back to us getting the credit on the current order. Would you take payments the next month and give the books out the current month?.

Additional Comments: Make sure you are clear on your promotional items for the 2023-2024 school year.  For example, if you are promising students free stickers with any book order, make sure you either a) have enough stickers for all students who place an order or b) state on the flyer students will receive free stickers with book order or while supplies last. My preschool students did not receive their stickers.  Yes, they received a poster, but a poster is not the same as stickers.  Just a suggestion.  This made a difference when it came time for my parents to order the next month from Scholastic.  Thank you all for a wonderful year.  I look forward to introducing my new families to Scholastic when we start the 2023-2024 school year.

Additional Comments: I've noticed that some books are now labeled with "Some mature content" or "some adolescent themes", and I am really annoyed because there's not reason listed for why those books are tagged that way. Is it language? Is it violence? I like that Scholastic is tagging the books like that, as I don't have time to read every book in my student library, but I would really like to know WHY something is "mature" or "adolescent". Please. It would make it a lot easier to choose books.

What Issues: I just related  my problem when answering the first question.
What could we improve: My order was so poorly packed that over three-quarters of the items that I ordered were damaged.  The order was packed in a 9W box and my husband and I were able to repack the books in a 5W with NO space to be bounced around.  These books are given to a classroom of children at a public school that I volunteer in weekly or a Guardian ad Litem group that I donate books to numerous times a year (in March, it was 200 books)!  The three Dinomite hard covered books were special gifts for my six years old friends that I let pick out their own books a few times a year.  I have already contacted Customer Service and spoke with a very nice young lady who resolved my problem quickly and will replace said books.  This is not the first time that this has happened and makes me wonder why I continue my alliance with Scholastic after all these years.

What could we improve: Your book selection has declined since COVID. ADDITIONALLY (and this is the MAIN REASON), the monthly bonus awards you are currently offering  are not consistent in their value OR nearly as enticing. For instance, my April book order was over $200 and I didn’t receive ANY free books for my classroom. Instead you now give me a $10 certificate to use (Heaven forbid I lose that little piece of paper) with my May order BUT only if spend $25+. Honestly, I have been promoting Scholastic to my kids and their parents for YEARS (over 20 to be exact).  However, if your book selection doesn’t improve AND your teacher incentive rewards don’t go back to what they once were, I’ll skip all of the extra steps it takes to promote Scholastic and just go through Amazon.

The orders were completely correct and shipped out very fast.  This quick delivery was so nice because we only have preschool until Friday, May 12.  We wanted to offer the summer book selections and I took a chance in sending out the brochures, with the hopes of having the books in time.  I am very pleased that I do not have to deliver the books to the families after school.  It was very quick!  Thank you.
Additional Comments: It is nice to see the quality service we have come to know and expect! We understand the last couple years were difficult and you did your best with what you had, but it seems as if everything is back to normal with quality customer service!  The customer service representatives are also all very kind and very helpful!  It has been a joy participating in the Scholastic Book Program!  Thank you!

What Issues: See how to impove comment. I have received a box at the school with the student magazines but no coupons to send home with the student who's order is now a month delayed.,I have not received a package;
What could we improve: emailed book coupons for me to send to the parent while they waited. Also, make it easier to contact a human by offering the customer service number in the email notifying me they were delayed. I had to search through the email and web site for 20 minutes after clicking on contact us, email us past a lot of large FAQ tabs completely unrelated to a lost book order. Within one minute the human I spoke with could tell me that it was still in transit 1 month later and was being shipped to the home. I had no access to the order through my teacher page to see that was the case. That also would have been helpful to keep the sale in my order history on my teacher page until the order had arrived.
Additional Comments: When you do not offer customer service in a convient way for the teacher and the parent, but make us track down the problem, you create more work for me and the parent. I've worked very hard to convince this parent that getting books into her child's hands at home 7 days a week would improve his reading skills. You have dropped the ball in a way that has created problems for the teacher. I've had Scholastic Book orders for 28 years of teaching. This lack of customer service where you just send an email and make the contact information a small font at the very bottom and 3 clicks after the email, when something has gone wrong, is reason enough for me to reconsider further purchases with future classes until I see an improvement with this problem.

What Issues: I have not received a package;
What could we improve: The package should not have been given to the USPS. I still have not received either package yet. They said they attempted deliver at 3:40 on Friday, which is not true. The secretary and I were in the office until 6pm. Then they attempted delivery on Saturday, what school is open on a Saturday? They then say they attempted deliver on Monday and Tuesday at 6:21 and 6:36, again what school is open that late. Now they are saying next attempt will be this Saturday and again no one will be there. I am very upset. I know you have no control over USPS. (Sorry, just needed to vent) Next time I will have it sent to my home as my post office is much more reliable, I actually receive my packages in a timely manor. I'm not even sure which post office has the packages. I am sure once I finally receive my packages they will be fine and my class will be very happy.

We get very excited to receive a book box in the office but with no name it wasn't as fun.  Our time out of the classroom is limited.

What could we improve: Keep my account updated. Since the "new computer " program from this past summer, my experience with scholastic has been  horrible. Every call ended with we have your account updated and there should be no more glitches.  Very frustrated, since our school and scholastic have had an account for 28 years.

Additional Comments: I'll try to be quick with this explanation.  Last school year, a Scholastic box was delivered to our school but nobody knew the name that was on the box.  It was put in the office, waiting for someone to claim it and as the months (including last summer) have passed, it was moved to different spots because it was unclaimed.  Last week, I was organizing a closet and stumbled upon this box.  I realized it had an address that wasn't the school's so I decided to write a note to this person, asking if they ordered books last year that were never delivered.  I included my cell number and today, this lady contacted me, informing me that she HAD ordered books last school year, she got a notice that they were delivered, but she never actually received them.  She figured someone had stolen them from her mailbox.  Somehow, they were mistakenly delivered to our school - Not Scholastic's mistake.  Her daughter attends the other elementary school in district, and I'm going to make sure she gets her books.  I thought I'd let you know this happened.  The information is:  ORDER #: O57196891   ACCOUNT #:  30351764    DATE:  2/06/2022 (Yes, over a year ago!)   Supposed to be shipped to:  Amanda Williams   945 E. Bass Lake Road   Gwinn, MI. 49841         *I realize it was the mistake of the post office, but there are a number of books in this order and her child is a year and a half older now.

It wasn't until several weeks later that I received an email saying that the order would be submitted for me that I realized that parents had placed orders. This created a delay and the Easter books that families had ordered did not arrive until many weeks after Easter.  *And the only reason that I had an Early Childhood flyer to even send home to parents was because a colleague gave me hers to pass out. Even though I have requested this catalog multiple times in my 18 years in this position, it is not sent to me. What could we improve: The system automatically place my order and I didn't get my books ordered so when I went to order they were going to charge me shipping.  I wouldn't have had shipping if I was able to place the order so I didn't get any of my books I wanted.  Very frustrated.

What was great: I never have to wait long for my order.
Additional Comments: I was a little bummed out to have the feature taken away which allows a teacher to earn "money to spend now" once the total dollar amount reached a certain point. The feature has been changed to "money earned" and you can use the money the next month BUT only when a minimum dollar amount is purchased. So now you actually have to have twice the amount in order to earn money to spend as a teacher. That is not really a fair change. As a teacher, I have found that parents may not order Scholastic books every month... so when I was not allowed to use the money earned when it was earned, I was unable to make any purchase for the class because I did not meet the minimum dollar amount spent for shipping. I feel like this new feature is going to limit the classroom's ability to build a library because some teachers (like myself) will not be able to meet the new guidelines and many teachers cannot afford to spend their own money on shipping or classroom library books.

What Issues: cannot get my address correct in the system.,I have not received a package;,My order has incorrect items and/or missing items;
What could we improve: Deliver to the correct address. Month after month, I have had to contact Scholastic regarding the address for flyers and book orders. Each time I have spoken with customer service, I am told. "It's fixed"and that the correct address is in the system. For some reason, the system keeps sending everything to the school address. The book orders do come to my home address because I click that option, but the reorder of books that did not make it in the order were shipped to the school.  This has been extremely frustrating.
Additional Comments: Would actually like the correct address in the system. This is not a customer service rep. issue this is IT's dept.

What was great: All the books that were ordered were in the boxes.

What Issues: Explained in previous notation....my $10 coupon to use with my May order would not work, nor could I redeem my 500 bonus points I received via email, nor did it credit me the additional 50 bonus points for my order over $25....just frustrating that I could not redeem ANY of these items in my May order.
What could we improve: The shipping was fine, but VERY frustrated with Scholastic online ordering...it would not let me use the $10 to spend in May coupon from our April order. It is also would not let me redeem my 500 bonus points I had received from Scholastic on Teacher Appreciation week, nor did it give me the 50 bonus points for an order over $25. Frustrating!

What Issues: Was not able to include classroom orders as Scholastic took it upon themselves to submit my online order from a parent and ship it to my school.

I did not have enough money then to add to the rest for free shipping, so I was not able to turn in my order.  I contacted Scholastic and they said they don't let orders sit there, which is not true as all year I will collect orders and submit at my cut off date.  They said they would honor free shipping, but when I went to submit it was charging me.  I don't think I should have to continue to reach out all the time.  It makes me sad to see how unorganized and how many phone calls I have had to make the past few years regarding orders.

(Never wanted to miss an issue of Dynamite!)  The Scholastic logo is a sign to me that the product is quality, which is why I also use StoryWorks 3 and Scholastic News.  Keep up the good work!  If I have any grandchildren I will make sure to order books for them through Scholastic!

What was great: Easy to order, packaged well and quick shipping.
Books arrived quickly.

What could we improve: I had to contact Scholastic several different times because my large order (over $1,000) was taking longer than usual to ship.
Additional Comments: I was completely shocked to find out that one of my parent online orders in May was submitted automatically.  My class orders were not due for several more days, so I hadn't entered my teacher orders before the automatic shipment happened.  I had a $10 coupon that I was going to use, as well.  The email I received from that shipment mentioned that this is a new feature that will (hopefully) be optional next year.  I will DEFINITELY be turning that off next year!  I do not have control over when parents will be placing their orders, and I want to wait until all families have a chance to order so that I can take advantage of free shipping for everyone.  Sometimes, I get families who pay me in cash for orders less than $25.  I can combine their small order with the online orders to qualify for free shipping, if I control when the order is placed and it doesn't happen by Scholastic automatically.  Thank you for continuing to offer such wonderful books for my students to read at home, and for me to use in my classroom.  I LOVE earning bonus points from family orders so that I can keep reading new and amazing stories!  :D

What was great: timely

What could we improve: I had a parent order after my order was sent in. I was happy that you honored it, but I don't think I got the bonus points. No biggie though. I am retiring!
Additional Comments: I also think I had to pay for shipping because I didn't have enough orders until that late one went in.  On another note: I have used you for book orders for probably more that 30 years, (Weekly Reader before that I think.) During whole language, I spent tons of my own money to buy book sets for my class and have my own bookroom! I appreciated having bonus points to get more book sets for my class. That is a great feature. The online ordering is a great improvement. In the last several years I haven't had as many parent orders because our librarian does a Scholastic Book Fair twice a year to earn books for the library and the parents can get them immediately and don't have to wait for an order.  But I have appreciated Scholastic over the years for book orders and Scholastic News. I have introduced new teachers to your site. You allowed me to give my students a gift book for Christmas and the end of the year. Thank you for everything and good luck!

What could we improve: My online orders were automatically processed on the 30 of April.  I do NOT want Scholastic putting my orders in for me.  I had two paper orders on my desk to add into that order that I had to pass off to another teacher to add in with her May order for me.  Not to mention I couldn't place my own personal teacher order that I was going to place.  I missed out on all my bonus points I could have had from combining all those orders together.  Just because it's the end of the month doesn't mean that I'm ready to place my order.  I had told my parents that I would not be doing a combined April/May order and that they had until the 7th of May to order, but all of a sudden I had a book box of books to hand out, and it took me a week to figure out who had placed the order without my knowledge or consent.  Then I read about your new policy in automatically placing the online orders at the end of the month and I was very upset that you would do this.  At the very least, you should have given me an e-mail asking me if you could place the order for me or not.  PLEASE DO NOT DO THIS AGAIN.  When I told the other teachers in my building about this, they were all equally upset by this. This policy does not work.  I still get quite a number of paper flyer orders from my students.
Additional Comments: I would like to see a statement in each book box telling me what my current balance is and what I owe.  Your new online method is inconvenient and does not work.  I never know what I owe, and it's a hassle to remember to log in and try to find my bill.  If the bill is in the box each time, it's in-sight, and in-mind and will get paid in a very timely manner.  Now it's out-of-sight, and out-of-mind, and it took me several months to finally get my bill paid, which I have never done before in all my 28 years of teaching.  I felt horrible.  PLEASE put my monthly statement in the book box like you used to do pre-covid.  It worked much better, and was one less thing out of the hundreds of things that teachers have to remember and deal with daily.  THANK YOU.

What was great: It is easy to order the books.  Since parents can order and pay online, it makes my job even easier!
Additional Comments: I appreciate all of the offers for bonus points, but you make it difficult to redeem them.  Offering $10 in free books is nice, but you don't have many $2 or  $5 books to choose from.  Keeping track of a postcard with a bonus code is annoying.  The bonus should be applied to the account when it is earned.  I guess you are counting on the fact that teachers will lose the code so you don't have to honor the bonus.

What Issues: My order has incorrect items and/or missing items;
What could we improve: The only issue I had was with communication in regards to a book missing from my order. My first contact said a replacement request had been entered. When the book was not delivered after 2 weeks, I again contacted support. This time I was told the book had been unavailable and the family had received a refund. I confirmed that the family did indeed receive the refund, but letting me know (since I was inquiring) would have saved me a bit of time.
There were a few items that were sold out but still came out in other flyers.

What was great: It is just very easy from start to finish!
